intro: Erythranthe eastwoodiae, commonly known as Eastwood's monkeyflower, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as streambanks and meadows. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
